pageContent.title: <Introtext style="font-family:Helvetica; font-size:14pt; font-weight:bold; color:#cc0033; margin:10px -5px 10px 5px; padding:5px 0 5px 5px; background:#e8e8e8; border-bottom:1px solid #333; display:block;">Aligning with Customer Needs</Introtext>
pageContent.title2: Meeting with Dr. Hayes – Aligning with the Customer’s Needs
pageContent.instructions: <welcomeText style=" font-family:Helvetica; font-size:11pt; line-height:18pt; text-align:justify; font-weight:bold; color:#333; display:block; margin:0 10px 10px">Which question will you ask Dr. Hayes first?</welcomeText>

choice.choiceText: A. During my previous talks with Dr. Bennett, we’ve discussed therapy and treatment options for depression. Can you tell me more about the opportunities for treating depression that you see?
B. With the ongoing healthcare reform and increasing regulations, what issues do you see potentially affecting your practice?
C. It sounds like protecting your practice’s reputation, as well as expanding your practice, are two of your priorities. What are your next steps to address those priorities?

D. From previous conversations with Dr. Bennett, I’ve learned that you want to continue building your practice’s reputation and patient base. In order to achieve those goals, what are the short- and long-term patient outcomes you want to see?

pageContent.title: <Introtext style="font-family:Helvetica; font-size:14pt; font-weight:bold; color:#cc0033; margin:10px -5px 10px 5px; padding:5px 0 5px 5px; background:#e8e8e8; border-bottom:1px solid #333; display:block;">Further Aligning with Customer Needs</Introtext>
pageContent.title2: Meeting with Dr. Hayes – Further Aligning with the Customer’s Needs
pageContent.instructions: <welcomeText style=" font-family:Helvetica; font-size:11pt; line-height:18pt; text-align:justify; font-weight:bold; color:#333; display:block; margin:0 10px 10px">What do you ask Dr. Hayes at this point?</welcomeText >

choice.choiceText: A. You mentioned that building your practice’s reputation is part of your short-term goals. What challenges do you think you will face as you begin seeing additional patients?
B. Clearly, patient outcomes are key to receiving referrals from satisfied patients – and, ultimately, driving your short-term goals. Since compliance seems to be an issue, how do you track that?
C. As part of your long-term goals, how will you determine which additional areas of specialty you should focus on?
D. What is your timeline for assessing patient satisfaction?

pageContent.title: <Introtext style="font-family:Helvetica; font-size:14pt; font-weight:bold; color:#cc0033; margin:10px -5px 10px 5px; padding:5px 0 5px 5px; background:#e8e8e8; border-bottom:1px solid #333; display:block;">Beginning to Identify Areas of Value Creation</Introtext>
pageContent.title2: Meeting with Dr. Hayes – Beginning to Identify Areas of Value Creation
pageContent.instructions: <welcomeText style=" font-family:Helvetica; font-size:11pt; line-height:18pt; text-align:justify; font-weight:bold; color:#333; display:block; margin:0 10px 10px">What do you ask Dr. Hayes next?</welcomeText>

choice.choiceText: A. Ensuring that patients receive the appropriate and best medication helps to increase patient satisfaction. What strategies will you use to ensure minimal disruptions to your staff and patients, when needing to deal with issues like formularies?
B. Operationally, what changes do you think you may need to make within your practice as you begin seeing more patients with different types of psychiatric disorders?
C. As a physician treating disillusioned patients, what actions do you need to take in order to gain patients’ trust?
D. What challenges stand in the way of making the right prescribing decision the first time around?

pageContent.title: <Introtext style="font-family:Helvetica; font-size:14pt; font-weight:bold; color:#cc0033; margin:10px -5px 10px 5px; padding:5px 0 5px 5px; background:#e8e8e8; border-bottom:1px solid #333; display:block;">Exploring Areas of Value Creation</Introtext>
pageContent.title2: Meeting with Dr. Hayes – Exploring Areas of Value Creation
pageContent.instructions: <welcomeText style=" font-family:Helvetica; font-size:11pt; line-height:18pt; text-align:justify; font-weight:bold; color:#333; display:block; margin:0 10px 10px">Which question will you ask Dr. Hayes to move the conversation forward?</welcomeText>

choice.choiceText: A. You mentioned that expanding your areas of specialty was part of your long-term goals. How do you plan to build that part of your practice and become recognized in these new areas?
B. Ensuring that you achieve high levels of patient satisfaction can be very hard. What challenges do you foresee?
C. Given the strategies you’ve just described, what barriers do you face in achieving the outcomes you’re working toward?
D. Whom could I talk to in your office about educational events your practice may want to consider attending?

pageContent.title: <Introtext style="font-family:Helvetica; font-size:14pt; font-weight:bold; color:#cc0033; margin:10px -5px 10px 5px; padding:5px 0 5px 5px; background:#e8e8e8; border-bottom:1px solid #333; display:block;">Understanding the Context for the Solution and Maximizing Value</Introtext>
pageContent.title2: Meeting with Dr. Hayes – Understanding the Context for the Solution and Maximizing Value
pageContent.instructions: <welcomeText style=" font-family:Helvetica; font-size:11pt; line-height:18pt; text-align:justify; font-weight:bold; color:#333; display:block; margin:0 10px 10px">What do you ask Dr. Hayes at this point?</welcomeText>

choice.choiceText: A. How do you see currently available therapies and treatments fitting into how you treat your patients?
B. You’ve talked about a number of initiatives, some of which will take time. What is your timeline for expanding into these areas?
C. We have talked about your desired outcomes for the practice. How have they changed from last year?

D. New treatment areas will definitely provide an opportunity for your practice. However, with the ongoing healthcare reform and increasing regulations, what difficulties do you feel that you will have implementing your ideas?

pageContent.title: <Introtext style="font-family:Helvetica; font-size:14pt; font-weight:bold; color:#cc0033; margin:10px -5px 10px 5px; padding:5px 0 5px 5px; background:#e8e8e8; border-bottom:1px solid #333; display:block;">Further Understanding the Context for the Solution and Maximizing Value</Introtext>
pageContent.title2: Meeting with Dr. Hayes – Further Understanding the Context for the Solution and Maximizing Value
pageContent.instructions: <welcomeText style=" font-family:Helvetica; font-size:11pt; line-height:18pt; text-align:justify; font-weight:bold; color:#333; display:block; margin:0 10px 10px">Which follow-up question do you ask Dr. Hayes?</welcomeText>

choice.choiceText: A. What have you considered for your front office staff, so they would be better prepared to address and overcome the roadblocks you described?
B. What strategies do you have in place, if any, that would help reduce the frustrations of the roadblocks you encounter with different insurance plans, Medicare, and Medicaid?
C. What other obstacles do you face as you drive toward your goals for patient outcomes?
D. Who in your office is responsible for researching the potential roadblocks that may be faced, prior to starting a treatment?

pageContent.title: <Introtext style="font-family:Helvetica; font-size:14pt; font-weight:bold; color:#cc0033; margin:10px -5px 10px 5px; padding:5px 0 5px 5px; background:#e8e8e8; border-bottom:1px solid #333; display:block;">Collecting Information and Determining Next Steps</Introtext>
pageContent.title2: Meeting with Dr. Hayes – Collecting Information and Determining Next Steps
pageContent.instructions: <welcomeText style=" font-family:Helvetica; font-size:11pt; line-height:18pt; text-align:justify; font-weight:bold; color:#333; display:block; margin:0 10px 10px">Which question will you ask Dr. Hayes now to move the conversation to the next stage?</welcomeText>

choice.choiceText: A. Would you be interested in learning more about the co-pay cards that Otsuka makes available to patients?
B. What are your overall goals regarding efficiency?
C. If the administrative details can be overcome, what factors or criteria are most important to you when you consider trialing a product that you have never used before?
D. Have you considered ways of using patient education to help reduce call backs and improve the efficiency of your practice?

pageContent.title: <Introtext style="font-family:Helvetica; font-size:14pt; font-weight:bold; color:#cc0033; margin:10px -5px 10px 5px; padding:5px 0 5px 5px; background:#e8e8e8; border-bottom:1px solid #333; display:block;">Collecting Information and Determining Next Steps</Introtext>
pageContent.title2: Meeting with Dr. Hayes – Collecting Information and Determining Next Steps
pageContent.instructions: <welcomeText style=" font-family:Helvetica; font-size:11pt; line-height:18pt; text-align:justify; font-weight:bold; color:#333; display:block; margin:0 10px 10px">Which question will you ask Dr. Hayes next?</welcomeText>

choice.choiceText: A. I understand the challenges that you’re facing in your practice. How do you suggest that we discuss, with your entire staff, both the challenges and the ways that we can help you with them?

B. It’s clear that patient satisfaction will be critical in order to achieve the growth you’re targeting, as higher satisfaction will lead to more referrals. What are the specific patient satisfaction goals you’re trying to achieve?

C. Successfully treating your patients seems to be the foundation for your patient outcome goals. What are your thoughts regarding how expanding the base of products you prescribe could help achieve better patient outcomes?
D. Will you prescribe my product for your next depressed patient?
